text: <!channel>: i'm set up in echo chamber for our 1030.
we can move to the room with the planar if we need to.
<@U026AP8CM> the GUI option for auto-restarting the app is Lingon: <https://www.peterborgapps.com/lingon/>

attachments.text: Lingon is an easy to use utility that run things automatically on your Mac
attachments.fallback: Lingon is an easy to use utility that run things automatically on your Mac

text: <@U0265G76F>: I did a little bit of homework on touch screen hardware.   Planar has recently overhauled the "EP" line of displays - as in they no longer manufacture the display we/OMSI/ASC have.   In the overhaul, they have switched touch vendors to PQ Labs (And made the displays bigger 58" and 65" with 4k support).
oh interesting
The touch bezel they are now using is the G4 Basic 6 from here: <http://www.pqlabs.com/product_kit.html>
it's still an IR, but it's pretty much the best IR bezel out there and would have been the exact one that I would have suggested.
cool
does it ONLY come in bigger size?

the downfall of the mac is that the mac currently has ZERO gesture support.  Or atleast vendors haven't figured out how to make the touch panel be registered like a trackpad - so all touch screens for macs are current'y registering as a mouse device and thus much of our pain...
yes it ONLY comes in bigger.
They make a "PS" series that still comes in smaller
and those likewise have been upgraded recently to the PQ Labs touch bezels.   Those had been using ones from some vendor I dont know called Lumio
PS screens come in 46" (ASC),  55" (OMSI/us), 65", and 70"
This is the closest replacement to what we have that Planar now makes: <http://www.planar.com/products/large-format-displays/ps/ps5561t/>

attachments.text: Planar PS5561T, Ultra-slim 55" multi-touch LCD display offering up to 6 touch points and is compatible with Windows 7, 8, Vista, XP, MacOS X and Linux.
attachments.fallback: Planar PS5561T, Ultra-slim 55" multi-touch LCD display offering up to 6 touch points and is compatible with Windows 7, 8, Vista, XP, MacOS X and Linux.

text: It also cost 1/2 the price compared tothe one we have ($5k instead of $10k)
<!channel> so I'm pretty sure that mouse cursor bug is all because of the hardware. in particular, the IR bezel and its driver.
assuming we change that out, the problem _should_ go away
I don't know yet about using a software solution to catch the error
<@U026NB2U2>: Do you care if I directly email Planar with questions about upgrading the touch bezel?
I have two planar email addresses in my inbox from 1.5 years ago when we were first trying to do this with OMSI.
no issues whatsoever - maybe cc Karen and me for continuity's sakes
(or maybe name recognition from back then)

<!channel> today I tried to work out the mouse-cursor/scrolling-stopped-working/things-on-top-of-other-things bug. I may have fixed it but I can't tell. The mouse cursor still does show up sometimes though, because there's a second bug that causes that (related, but only at a very high level)
oh also I did the change to the "Filter Topic" copy.
